headline.main: Houthi Leader Rejects Yemen Truce: Twitter Account
headline.print_headline: Houthi Leader Rejects Yemen Truce: Twitter Account

docs.snippet: The leader of Yemen's Houthi movement has rejected a ceasefire planned by its Saudi-led Arab coalition adversary, saying such a truce would benefit only Islamic State and al Qaeda, according to a message posted on the group's Twitter account....
docs.lead_paragraph: The leader of Yemen's Houthi movement has rejected a ceasefire planned by its Saudi-led Arab coalition adversary, saying such a truce would benefit only Islamic State and al Qaeda, according to a message posted on the group's Twitter account.

headline.main: Senior Republicans Rebuke Cruz Over His Attacks on McConnell
headline.print_headline: Senior Republicans Rebuke Cruz Over His Attacks on McConnell

docs.snippet: Senior Senate Republicans lined up Sunday to rebuke Texas Republican Sen. Ted Cruz for harshly criticizing Majority Leader Mitch McConnell, an extraordinary display of intraparty division played out live on the Senate floor....
docs.lead_paragraph: Senior Senate Republicans lined up Sunday to rebuke Texas Republican Sen. Ted Cruz for harshly criticizing Majority Leader Mitch McConnell, an extraordinary display of intraparty division played out live on the Senate floor.

headline.main: Lawsuit Reveals Extent of Ethiopian Hacking Amid Obama Visit
headline.print_headline: Lawsuit Reveals Extent of Ethiopian Hacking Amid Obama Visit

docs.snippet: As President Barack Obama faces pressure to discuss human rights in his first official visit to Ethiopia this weekend, a unique lawsuit back home is challenging whether the African country can spy on an American by turning his computer into a gian...
docs.lead_paragraph: As President Barack Obama faces pressure to discuss human rights in his first official visit to Ethiopia this weekend, a unique lawsuit back home is challenging whether the African country can spy on an American by turning his computer into a giant recording device.

headline.main: Pope Calls for Release of Priest, Bishops Abducted in Syria
headline.print_headline: Pope Calls for Release of Priest, Bishops Abducted in Syria

docs.snippet: Pope Francis on Sunday appealed for the release of an Italian Jesuit priest and two Orthodox bishops kidnapped in Syria two years ago, asking leaders to work for the freedom of all those abducted there....
docs.lead_paragraph: Pope Francis on Sunday appealed for the release of an Italian Jesuit priest and two Orthodox bishops kidnapped in Syria two years ago, asking leaders to work for the freedom of all those abducted there.

headline.main: Stosur Beats Knapp in 3 Sets to Win Gastein Ladies
headline.print_headline: Stosur Beats Knapp in 3 Sets to Win Gastein Ladies

docs.snippet: Samantha Stosur rallied to defeat third-seeded Karin Knapp of Italy 3-6, 7-6 (3), 6-2 in the final of the Gastein Ladies on Sunday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Samantha Stosur rallied to defeat third-seeded Karin Knapp of Italy 3-6, 7-6 (3), 6-2 in the final of the Gastein Ladies on Sunday.

headline.main: Thai Airways to Cut 1,401 Jobs, Suspend Flights to U.S.
headline.print_headline: Thai Airways to Cut 1,401 Jobs, Suspend Flights to U.S.

docs.snippet: Thai Airways International Pcl plans to cut 1,401 jobs through voluntary retirement this year and suspend its loss-making flights to Los Angeles and Rome as it pushes ahead with a restructuring plan, its president said on Sunday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Thai Airways International Pcl plans to cut 1,401 jobs through voluntary retirement this year and suspend its loss-making flights to Los Angeles and Rome as it pushes ahead with a restructuring plan, its president said on Sunday.

headline.main: Minister: Greek Bailout Talks Format Still Being Negotiated
headline.print_headline: Minister: Greek Bailout Talks Format Still Being Negotiated

docs.snippet: Greece and rescue lenders are still working out the format of upcoming talks, the labor minister said Sunday, confirming a delay in the negotiations for a third international bailout....
docs.lead_paragraph: Greece and rescue lenders are still working out the format of upcoming talks, the labor minister said Sunday, confirming a delay in the negotiations for a third international bailout.

headline.main: U.S. Auto Safety Regulators Fine Fiat Chrysler Record $105 Million
headline.print_headline: U.S. Auto Safety Regulators Fine Fiat Chrysler Record $105 Million

docs.snippet: The U.S. auto safety watchdog, toughening its stance against manufacturer defects, announced on Sunday a record $105 million in fines against Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV over lapses in safety recalls involving millions of vehicles....
docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. auto safety watchdog, toughening its stance against manufacturer defects, announced on Sunday a record $105 million in fines against Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV over lapses in safety recalls involving millions of vehicles.

headline.main: Pope Signs Himself Up for World Youth Day Using Tablet
headline.print_headline: Pope Signs Himself Up for World Youth Day Using Tablet

docs.snippet: Pope Francis opened the registration period for next year's World Youth Day in Poland, using a tablet computer to sign himself up from a window overlooking St. Peter's Square during the traditional Sunday blessing....
docs.lead_paragraph: Pope Francis opened the registration period for next year's World Youth Day in Poland, using a tablet computer to sign himself up from a window overlooking St. Peter's Square during the traditional Sunday blessing.
